author: Jeff Parsons
title: What does the 8-ball Facebook emoji mean and why are people posting it?
text:
The 8-ball (Photo: Universal Images Group Editorial) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
If you've been using Facebook recently, you may have noticed a lot of 8-ball emojis popping up on your newsfeed. 
The mysterious status update is leaving more than a few people befuddled. Does it mean there's a pool tournament happening somewhere nearby? 
In fact, the answer is a lot simpler. The 8-ball emoji is being used as a way of raising awareness for prostate cancer . According to Dublin Live , the 8 represents the second half of the cancer it refers to. 
Radical new opioid drug could provide pain relief without risk of addiction (Photo: Getty) 
The campaign to raise awareness has even spread to posting site Reddit, where users debated the meaning behind it. 
"Trying to raise awareness for prostate cancer can all you men (only men ) (i made this one up for you blokes).can you please put a [8-ball]on your wall dont comment then send this on to all your male mates," wrote one user. 
Each year about 46,000 men in the UK are diagnosed with prostate cancer and 11,000 die from the disease. 
Breast cancer risk can be cut by 40% if you eat a Mediterranean diet Surgeons and staff operating on a prostate cancer patient (Photo: Trinity Mirror) 
For localised non-aggressive cancers, doctors often employ a “watchful waiting” strategy that involves no treatment unless the disease shows signs of progressing.
